Description: Terracotta female figure fragment. Arms out-stretched. Solid mould-made plaque-figure with plain back. Wearing long robes showing East Greek influence. Possibly traces of slip or coating for painted decoration. Red-brown fabric with grey-black core. Black inclusions with some small vessicles. Dense fabric.
Curator's comments: Only front view of figure seen. Similar pieces from the British Museum (1903,1215.6; 1864,1007.1264; 1864,1007.1268; Higgins 1970, nos 21-37, 1118 on throne).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.005) (Phase 3)
